title: Strengthening Practical AI Competencies: Tensor-Based Regression Learning with Applied Projects

context.prior_knowledge: Linear Algebra, Regression Analysis Fundamentals, and Programming (Python/R) Experience
context.additional_context: Advanced AI/machine learning technical course for AI/ML practitioners

learning_goals: Explain mathematical principles (matrix operations, loss functions, gradient descent) of tensor-based linear/nonlinear regression models (1st/2nd order), implementing models with ≤0.15 MAE on housing price prediction datasets using TensorFlow/Keras
Apply procedures for deriving regression results using Moore-Penrose inverse tensor operations

Learners can explain the hierarchical structure of a Type-2 fuzzy system (inference engine, fuzzification interface, defuzzification method) and implement a fuzzy rule-based classification model on three sets of real industrial data (e.g., manufacturing process data), achieving an accuracy of 85% or higher.

Learners can implement ELM, Online Sequential ELM (OS-ELM), and Incremental ELM (I-ELM) models on datasets ranging from 1,000 to 50,000 samples over a 1–6 month course and write a performance comparison analysis report based on accuracy, precision, recall, and F1-score.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
